content: I do recognise that they are different in terms of composition style although having similar shared focuses, but I think it was mostly the orchestration and the romantic atmosphere created by the musicality of it. Tchaikovsky's art songs actually don't sound as classical as his ballet music. I have been listening to a couple of his art songs throughout the past couple of days. Also, "more classical" is a relative definition. Tchaikovsky absolutely sounds less classical compared to Beethoven or Bach. Do you think that Prokofiev was influenced by Tchaikovsky in terms of his interest in ballet music? And what do you think about the similarities and differences between Mahler and Shostakovich?
